author: Special Correspondent
text:
Students writing the SSLC exam on the first day at a centre in Tiruchi on Tuesday.— PHOTO: B. VELANKANNI RAJ

A total of 40,136 students appeared for the Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC) examinations that began here on Tuesday.

Of them, 20,249 students were boys and 19,887 were girls. The examinations were held in 427 schools across the district.

Collector K.S. Palanisamy visited the Bishop Heber Higher Secondary School and monitored the conduct of examinations. He was accompanied by the Chief Educational Officer N. Anandi.

He said 144 Chief Superintendents had been appointed for supervising the examinations in 144 centres. A number of steps were made to prevent malpractices such as copying and impersonation. Flying squads had been asked to carry out surprise checks in their respective centres to prevent malpractices.

As per the standard procedure, 118 teachers had been nominated to assist 118 blind students in writing the examinations.
title: SSLC examinations off to smooth start
